metadata.Title: CVE-2019-11720 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.Description: Some unicode characters are incorrectly treated as whitespace during theparsing of web content instead of triggering parsing errors. This allowsmalicious code to then be processed, evading cross-site scripting (XSS)filtering. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 68.

criterions.comment: firefox: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
